flight.destination: Guwahati (Lokpriya Gopinath Bordoloi International Airport - GAU)

hotel.name: Hotel President
hotel.address: G.S. Road, Opp. Doordarshan Kendra, Paltan Bazaar, Guwahati, Assam 781007

dailyItinerary.optimizedRoute: Hotel President → Umananda Temple → Hotel President
dailyItinerary.weather: Cloudy, 29°C high, 21°C low. UV index 4.9. No rain. Prepare for a warm day.

places.name: Arrival at Guwahati & Check-in to Hotel President
places.description: Welcome to Guwahati, the gateway to Northeast India. Upon arrival at Lokpriya Gopinath Bordoloi International Airport (GAU), you will take a pre-booked taxi or a ride-sharing service to your hotel. The journey offers the first glimpses of the bustling city life set against the backdrop of lush green hills. Check into Hotel President, a well-located and budget-friendly choice perfect for your stay. Settle in, unpack, and take a moment to relax before you begin your Assamese adventure. The hotel staff can provide you with any immediate assistance or information you might need for your stay.
places.whyVisit: This is the essential first step to settle in after your flight, ensuring you are refreshed and ready for the evening's exploration without any travel fatigue.
activities: Complete the check-in process
Unpack and organize your luggage
Freshen up after your journey

safetyNotes: Keep your luggage with you at all times at the airport.
Confirm the taxi fare before starting the journey.

places.name: Umananda Temple (Peacock Island)
places.description: Embark on a serene journey to Peacock Island, the smallest inhabited river island in the world, located in the middle of the mighty Brahmaputra river. The island is home to the Umananda Temple, a 17th-century shrine dedicated to Lord Shiva. To reach it, you'll take a short but scenic ferry ride from the Umananda Ghat. The temple's tranquil atmosphere, combined with the panoramic views of the river and the city during sunset, creates a truly magical experience. It's a perfect blend of spirituality and natural beauty, offering a peaceful escape from the city's hustle.
places.whyVisit: A perfect introduction to Guwahati's spiritual side, offering a unique experience of visiting a temple on a river island with stunning sunset views.
activities: Take a ferry across the Brahmaputra River
Explore the architecture of the Shiva temple
Enjoy the panoramic sunset views from the island

whatToBuy: Small religious trinkets from stalls near the ghat
safetyNotes: Be cautious on the ferry jetty, it can be slippery.
Note the time for the last ferry back to the mainland.
customsEtiquette: Dress modestly as it is a place of worship.
Remove shoes before entering the temple premises.
photoSpots: On the ferry with the city skyline in the background
The temple entrance with intricate rock carvings

dailyItinerary.optimizedRoute: Hotel President → Kamakhya Temple → Assam State Museum → Srimanta Sankaradeva Kalakshetra → Hotel President
dailyItinerary.weather: Cloudy, 28°C high, 23°C low. UV index 5.0. No rain. Warm and humid conditions.

places.name: Kamakhya Temple
places.description: Perched atop the Nilachal Hills, the Kamakhya Temple is one of the most revered Shakti Peeths in India, a major center for Tantrism. This sacred site is unique as it does not house a conventional idol; instead, the main deity is a yoni-shaped rock formation fed by a natural underground spring. The temple complex, with its distinctive beehive-like shikhara, offers a powerful spiritual ambiance. Devotees and visitors alike flock here to seek blessings and witness the ancient rituals. The panoramic view of Guwahati city and the Brahmaputra river from the temple hilltop is an added bonus to this profound spiritual experience.
places.whyVisit: A must-visit for its immense religious significance and unique form of worship, offering a deep dive into the spiritual heart of Assam.
activities: Seek blessings at the main sanctum
Observe the unique temple architecture
Enjoy the panoramic city view from the hilltop

practicalInfo.entryFee: Free entry. VIP pass available for 500 INR per person to bypass long queues.
practicalInfo.bestTime: Early morning to avoid the biggest crowds

whatToBring: Socks, as you'll have to remove footwear
safetyNotes: Beware of touts offering special pujas at exorbitant prices.
Keep your belongings secure in crowded areas.
customsEtiquette: Photography is restricted inside the main sanctum.

places.name: Assam State Museum
places.description: Dive into the rich history and cultural heritage of Assam at the Assam State Museum. Established in 1940, it is one of the largest multipurpose museums in Northeast India. The museum houses a vast collection of artifacts, sculptures, and manuscripts that trace the region's history from ancient to modern times. Key galleries include archaeology, epigraphy, numismatics, and natural history. It provides a comprehensive overview of the artistic, social, and cultural evolution of Assam, making it an enlightening experience for anyone interested in understanding the soul of the state beyond its natural beauty.
places.whyVisit: To gain a deep and comprehensive understanding of Assam's rich history, diverse culture, and archaeological significance all under one roof.
activities: Explore the sculpture and manuscript galleries
Learn about the Ahom dynasty's history
View the collection of tribal artifacts

whatToBring: Curiosity and an interest in history
A notebook to jot down interesting facts
whatToBuy: Books on Assamese history from the museum shop
safetyNotes: Some sections might be dimly lit, watch your step.
Follow the museum's rules on photography.
photoSpots: In front of the main museum building

places.name: Srimanta Sankaradeva Kalakshetra
places.description: Srimanta Sankaradeva Kalakshetra is a vibrant cultural institution that showcases the artistic and cultural richness of Assam and the entire Northeast region. Named after the revered Vaishnava saint and scholar Srimanta Sankaradeva, the complex is a masterpiece of Assamese architecture. It features a museum, an open-air theatre, art galleries, and a replica of a traditional Assamese village. The Bhupen Hazarika museum here is a special attraction. It's a place where you can witness traditional dance forms, listen to folk music, and admire local arts and crafts, offering a living, breathing experience of the region's diverse heritage.
places.whyVisit: It's a one-stop destination to experience the complete cultural tapestry of Assam, from its performing arts and music to its lifestyle and history.
activities: Walk through the replica Assamese village
Visit the Bhupen Hazarika Museum
Enjoy a cultural show if one is scheduled

practicalInfo.bestTime: Evening, when the complex is beautifully lit

safetyNotes: The complex is large, so keep track of your companions.
customsEtiquette: Do not litter the clean premises.
photoSpots: The main entrance gate with its grand architecture

dailyItinerary.weather: Partly cloudy, 29°C high, 22°C low. UV index 4.6. No rain. Expect a pleasant day.

places.name: Travel to Kaziranga National Park
places.description: Today, you will journey from the city of Guwahati to the wilderness of Kaziranga National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. After an early breakfast, you'll check out from your hotel and begin the scenic road trip. The drive takes you through the heart of Assam, passing by picturesque paddy fields, small towns, and lush green landscapes. This journey is an experience in itself, offering a glimpse into rural Assamese life. You will be traveling to a different world, leaving the urban environment behind for the sights and sounds of one of India's most celebrated wildlife sanctuaries.
places.whyVisit: This journey is the bridge between the cultural leg of your trip and the upcoming wildlife adventure, building anticipation for the Kaziranga experience.
activities: Enjoy the scenic drive through the Assamese countryside
Stop for a cup of authentic Assam tea at a roadside dhaba
Look out for changing landscapes as you near the park

whatToBring: Snacks and water for the journey
Music or a podcast for entertainment
safetyNotes: Ensure you book a reliable taxi service for the long journey.
Keep your valuables secure during brief stops.
photoSpots: Views of the Brahmaputra along parts of the highway

places.name: Jeep Safari in Kaziranga National Park (Western Range)
places.description: After checking into your resort and a quick lunch, get ready for the highlight of your trip: a jeep safari in Kaziranga National Park. You'll explore the Western Range (Bagori), known for its high density of the Great Indian One-Horned Rhinoceros. The open-jeep safari allows for excellent wildlife viewing and photography opportunities. Besides the majestic rhinos, you'll have the chance to spot wild elephants, swamp deer, wild water buffalo, and a plethora of bird species. The thrill of driving through the grasslands and marshes, with the raw beauty of nature all around, is an unforgettable experience.
places.whyVisit: This is a prime opportunity to see the iconic one-horned rhinoceros in its natural habitat and experience one of India's best wildlife safaris.
activities: Wildlife spotting and bird watching
Photography of flora and fauna
Learning about the park's ecosystem from your guide

practicalInfo.entryFee: Approx. 3000 INR per Jeep (includes entry permits, guide, and vehicle)
practicalInfo.bestTime: Afternoon safari offers good lighting for photos

whatToBring: A good zoom lens for your camera
Neutral-colored clothing to blend in with nature
whatToBuy: Souvenirs from the park's entrance gate shops
safetyNotes: Always follow the instructions of your guide.
Do not get down from the jeep at any point.
Maintain silence to not disturb the animals.
customsEtiquette: Respect the park's rules and regulations.
photoSpots: Any spot with a rhino sighting
The Donga viewpoint for panoramic views

dailyItinerary.weather: Partly cloudy, 29°C high, 20°C low. UV index 4.5. No rain. Slightly cooler evening.

places.name: Departure for Airport
places.description: After a final Assamese breakfast at your resort in Kaziranga, it's time to check out and bid farewell to the wilderness. You will embark on the return journey to Lokpriya Gopinath Bordoloi International Airport (GAU) in Guwahati for your flight back home. The drive will once again take you through the scenic landscapes of Assam, giving you one last chance to soak in the views. Reflect on the wonderful memories created over the past few days, from the spiritual temples of Guwahati to the thrilling rhino sightings in Kaziranga, as you head to the airport with a heart full of experiences.
places.whyVisit: This marks the conclusion of your memorable trip to Assam, ensuring a smooth and timely transfer to the airport for your journey home.
activities: Enjoy a final breakfast in Kaziranga
Check out from the resort
Travel back to Guwahati airport

practicalInfo.bestTime: Allow ample buffer time for traffic

whatToBuy: Last-minute tea packets or souvenirs from airport shops
safetyNotes: Double-check your room to ensure you haven't left anything behind.
Start for the airport well in advance to account for any delays.

budgetTips: Opt for combo meals at local restaurants to save on food expenses.
Use ride-sharing apps for city travel in Guwahati instead of private taxis for shorter distances.

Clothing: Light cotton clothes for the day
A light jacket or shawl for evenings
Modest attire for temple visits (covering shoulders and knees)
Footwear: A pair of sandals or flip-flops
Electronics: Camera with extra batteries and memory card

preTripChecklist.task: Book round-trip flights from Delhi (DEL) to Guwahati (GAU).
Book accommodation in Guwahati for 2 nights and in Kaziranga for 1 night.
Pre-book the Jeep Safari in Kaziranga online to ensure availability.
Arrange for airport transfers and inter-city cab from Guwahati to Kaziranga and back.
Pack clothes according to the weather forecast and planned activities.
Inform your bank about your travel dates to avoid any card issues.
Download offline maps of Guwahati and Kaziranga area.
